section.title: Overview
section.p: Operators can configure the Traffic Detection Function (TDF) servers similar to the Diameter client and select the right TDF within policy rules. IP-CAN Session Establishment with PCRF along with Sd session Establishment with TDF.
Following figure shows the traffic detection using the Sd interface:

Sd is the reference point located between the Policy and Charging Rules Function (PCRF) and TDF. Application Detection and Control (ADC) rules from the PCRF is provisioned for the purpose of traffic detection and enforcement at TDF. The start/stop of a detected application's traffic are reported based on the event trigger. The ADC rules that can be configured are Dynamic ADC rules and Predefined ADC rules.

ul.li: Verify that PCC Rule is installed on the Gx Interface on PGW and ADC Rule installed on Sd Interface with Event Triggers installed with Application Start and Application Stop on TDF.
Verify the CCR-I initial request comes towards PCRF from PGW.
PCRF initiates the TSR request message to TDF server to Install the ADC rule in ADC Rule Install AVP with all the required AVPs.
PCRF install the successfully Predefined PCC rule in the Charging rule Install AVP in CCA-I with Result code 2001 for IP_CAN session Establishment.
TDF server responses the TSA message to PCRF with Result code 2001.

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.
Pre-condition: Verify that the basic provisioning for Gx and Sd is done at NCC.

Define the condition with IPCAN_SESSION_ESTABLISHMENT trigger for establishing the TDF Policy.
Define the condition with IPCAN_SESSION_ESTABLISHMENT trigger for the definition of the PCC rule.
Define the default actions with SD_SESSION_ESTABLISHMENT trigger in new rule group to arm two default event triggers named Application_Start and Application_Stop for Sd interface.

Create the RSV and assign the PCRF condition for the SD SESSION Establishment for TDF selection. Define the condition for the ADC rule definition selection.
Note: The DSC.TDF server has the value of TDF host. It changes based on the TDF system.
Create the device E.164. To do this, navigate to Subscriber Manager and select the Devices tab. Click to create the device.
